summary: This bill, the Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act of 2026, outlines the appropriations for various government agencies and programs. It covers the Department of the Treasury, Executive Office of the President, the Judiciary, the District of Columbia, and independent agencies. The bill funds areas such as financial services, cybersecurity, the White House, court systems, emergency planning for the District of Columbia, election assistance, and the Federal Communications Commission. It also includes numerous administrative provisions, including limitations on the use of funds, and general provisions applicable to all agencies.
